Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyBooleanValues
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value is a boolean value. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameter. Acceptable boolean values are yes, no, true, false, 0, or 1. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter contains a boolean.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of boolean HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyIntegerValues
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of integer html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value is a whole number integer value. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameter. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter contains a whole number.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of integer HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyNumericValues
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of numeric html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value is a numeric value. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameter. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter contains a number, floating point or integer.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of numeric HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyPathNameValues
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of pathname html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value is a pathname value. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameter. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter contains a Path.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of Path HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyGuidValues
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of guid html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value is a guid value. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameter. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter contains a Guid.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of guid HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

Extension.name: sys_sortXml
Extension.initParam: Restructures the XML Document by sorting on first level elements

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: element
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: (required) The tag name of the element to use for sorting. This element should be 3 levels deep (root grand child).

Extension.name: sys_AllowOnlyTheseCharacters
Extension.initParam: Given a comma separated list of html parameters, will only pass the value to the server if the value matches the supplied regular expression. Otherwise the value is stripped and an empty string is returned for the parameters. Use to make sure that a supplied parameter matches a specific regex. Regular Expression should follow Java syntax.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: fields
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A comma separated list of guid HTML parameters / fields to be validated.

PSXExtensionParamDef.name: regex
PSXExtensionParamDef.description: A valid Java Regular Expression to be applied to the fields in the list.

Extension.name: Java
Extension.initParam: Processes extensions written in the Java language.

Extension.name: JavaScript
Extension.initParam: Processes scriptable functions written in the JavaScript language.
